intro: Paepalanthus muscosus var. tachirensis, commonly known as the Tachirean marsh plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important component of its local ecosystem. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
